total_impedance_ori_txt: R2 and Rc connected in series so Rb=R2+Rc=2 Ohm
R3 and Rb connected in series so Ra=R3+Rb=3 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 3 Ohm
total_impedance_txt: R2 and R1 connected in series so Rb=R2+R1=2 Ohm
R3 and Rb connected in series so Ra=R3+Rb=3 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 3 Ohm

request.text: What is the voltage on R1?

solution: At first we calculate the total resistance between the generator nodes (VS1)
R2 and R1 connected in series so Rb=R2+R1=2 Ohm
R3 and Rb connected in series so Ra=R3+Rb=3 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 3 Ohm
Now we calculate the voltage on R1
We know that the voltage between VS1 nodes is 6 V.
(1) The components R3,Rb connected in series.
(1) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 6 V.
(1) Rb is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Rb is Rb/Ra*6 V = 4 V.
(2) The components R2,R1 connected in series.
(2) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 4 V.
(2) R1 is in the voltage divider so the voltage on R1 is Rc/Rb*4 V = 2 V.
(3) The voltage on R1 is 2 V because the voltage is 2 V on R1
